text: hey I'm Bob and I like to make stuff
today we're gonna make a bike rack for
the whole family that you can fold up
and get out of the way quite a few years
ago I made a bike rack on this channel
and it was made to go in front of our
house under our carport to hold all of
the bikes and skateboards and scooters
and all that stuff that our family of
six has well now we've moved so we don't

this garage is full of other stuff and
most of it needs to stay in here except

stuff that goes with them let's do it

vertical pieces will also be a little

hopefully that whole thing can pivot
that way you can bring in a bike at

usually in bike racks you'll have a

allow it to capture the bike so you
really want to set the height of that
piece of plywood in its length based on
the wheels that you're putting in the
best way to do it is to measure down
from the center and go down an inch or
two and then make sure that you measure
the full dimension of the wheel so that
you have something to capture it from
front to back and as far up as possible

this video is sponsored by weld bond
which is a universal adhesive that i've
been using a ton lately in all different
situations you can bond just about
anything to just about anything and it's
non-toxic it dries clear but it's a
flexible and permanent bond so it's
great for woodworking projects where you
don't want to have that white or yellow
squeeze out but another thing that's
really cool about this stuff is you can
water it down and use it as a sealant if
you've got a cut edge of MDF and you
want to seal that up so it'll take paint
you could do that with this if you've
got some Eevee a foam for a prop and you
want to seal the surface you can do that
with this it's really fantastic stuff
and you should definitely check it out
it's become a staple here in our shop be
